newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Four firms may be delisted - Jakarta stock echange.
newsitem.headline: Four firms may be delisted - Jakarta stock echange.

text.p: The Jakarta stock exchange said it has sent letters to textile firm Pan Brothers Tex and three other small firms that they may be delisted due to poor financial performances or illiquidity.
"PT Bursa Efek Jakarta (the stock exchange) has sent a letter revealing a possible delisting to PT Pan Brothers Tex," the exchange said in a statement received on Monday.

The exchange also said it has sent letters to textile firm PT Great Golden Star, insurance firm PT Pool Asuransi and plastic manufacturer PT Langgeng Makmur Plastic Industry warning of possible delistings.
The exchange said Pan Brothers could face delisting due to its poor financial performance.
Pan Brothers had posted a retained loss of 54.1 billion rupiah in 1996 against a retained loss of 36.0 billion rupiah in 1995.
The company posted a net loss of 18.99 billion rupiah in 1996 against a net loss of 20.62 billion rupiah in 1995.
The other three firms have been found to be illiquid and the trading of their shares is extremely low, the exchange said.
The exchange said it had given until May 19 for the four firms to hold hearings with the exchange on the issue.
The statement did not give further details.
Officials of Pan Brothers and three others were not immediately available for comment.
